instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
why laptop force directly to dfu
when connecting to Apple Configurator it going directly to dfu without pressing keys

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
showing this error while restoring

"Unexpected device state 'DFU' expected 'Recovery' (Probably forced into DFU mode externally) [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFAE (4014)]"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you try both revive and restore?

Still appears in DFU, if keyboard is disconnected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
tried both
without kbd also appears dfu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SOC_FORCE_DFU</SIGNAL> level.
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, or <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> may cause the problem.
Test removing <RESISTOR>R8010</RESISTOR>.
